resources.string: This is a sample chat application that demonstrates how to follow Behavior-Driven Development (BDD), by writing unit tests that test the behavior that a user performs and the outcome that they perceive, without testing implementation details.
The tests are written in the Given-When-Then style and they cover the ViewModel, UseCase, and Repository layers, without using mocks.
Examine the structure of the tests in the ChatViewModelSpec.kt file to see how this works in practice.
For a comprehensive guide on how to follow this methodology, please refer to the \"Unit Testing Diet\" blog post.
